scenarios.title: Overwhelmed Freelancer
scenarios.summary: A freelancer is drowning in tasks, invoices, and deadlines. Multiple clients, scattered notes, and constant context-switching are leading to missed deadlines and cash flow problems.
what_ga_does: Maps all current obligations: pending invoices, project deadlines, recurring commitments
Identifies critical items: overdue invoices, approaching deadlines within 7 days
Builds a prioritized weekly execution plan with time blocks
Flags financial risks: unpaid invoices over 30 days, cash flow gaps
Sets up gentle recurring check-ins (weekly review prompt)
principles_applied: No automatic actions - GA suggests, human decides
Full transparency on what data is analyzed

scenarios.title: Student Approaching Burnout
scenarios.summary: A university student is overwhelmed by coursework, part-time job, and social pressure. Sleep is irregular, deadlines pile up, and motivation is fading. They need structure without adding more pressure.
what_ga_does: Gently inventories current commitments without judgment
Identifies the 3 most urgent academic deadlines
Suggests a minimal viable routine: sleep anchor, one daily priority
Offers to set up a low-pressure daily check-in (optional)
Provides resources for professional support if patterns suggest crisis
principles_applied: Wellbeing first - never adds pressure or guilt
Respects autonomy - all suggestions are optional

scenarios.title: Entrepreneur with Mounting Debt
scenarios.summary: A small business owner has accumulated personal debt to fund their startup. Revenue is growing but cash flow is unpredictable. They need clarity on their financial situation and a realistic path forward.
what_ga_does: Creates a clear debt inventory: amounts, interest rates, due dates
Maps revenue patterns from the past 6 months
Calculates debt service ratio and runway
Suggests prioritization strategy (avalanche vs snowball)
Flags decision points: when to seek professional advice
principles_applied: No financial advice - GA organizes information only
Recommends professional consultation for complex situations
Full audit trail of what was analyzed

scenarios.title: Parent Juggling Work and Family
scenarios.summary: A working parent feels constantly behind - work tasks spill into evenings, kids' activities are hard to track, and personal time has disappeared. They need a system that acknowledges real-life constraints.
what_ga_does: Maps fixed commitments: work hours, school schedules, recurring family events
Identifies time blocks that are truly available
Suggests batching similar tasks (errands, admin, focused work)
Creates a shared family calendar view (optional)
Builds in buffer time - realistic scheduling, not optimistic

scenarios.title: Retiree Managing Transition
scenarios.summary: A recently retired person is struggling with the sudden lack of structure. Days blur together, important tasks get forgotten, and there's anxiety about finances lasting. They need gentle scaffolding, not a rigid system.
what_ga_does: Creates a soft daily rhythm: anchor points, not strict schedules
Tracks important dates: medical appointments, bill payments, social commitments
Provides monthly financial health snapshot (spending vs budget)
Suggests one small engagement activity per week
Offers medication and appointment reminders (optional)
principles_applied: Safety nets for health and financial oversight
